title: Historical Stock Price Performance of Teleflex Inc during Significant Market Events

content.text: During the Great Depression, which lasted from 1929 to 1939, the stock market experienced a major crash in 1929. Teleflex Inc, founded in 1943, was not directly impacted by this event as it did not exist yet.

On October 19, 1987, known as Black Monday, the stock market experienced a significant crash. Teleflex Inc's stock price during this period decreased by approximately 37% from the beginning of the year until the end of October. However, it is important to note that Teleflex Inc's stock price had been declining prior to the crash.

During the dot-com bubble burst from 2000 to 2002, the stock market experienced a sharp decline. Teleflex Inc's stock price also declined during this period, reaching its lowest point in 2001. However, the impact on Teleflex Inc was somewhat limited compared to other technology companies, as it operates in the medical technology sector.

The global financial crisis, triggered by the collapse of Lehman Brothers in September 2008, led to a significant market crash. Teleflex Inc's stock price experienced a decline during this period, reaching its lowest point in early 2009. However, it started recovering slowly and eventually rebounded.

The COVID-19 pandemic, which began in early 2020, had a significant impact on global markets. Initially, Teleflex Inc's stock price experienced a decline along with the broader market. However, it quickly recovered and demonstrated resilience due to its involvement in the medical technology sector, which was crucial during the pandemic.

news.summary: Since early this century, the high-tech sector has picked up headlines and accolades – and rightly so. Our world is evolving into a technology-driven landscape, with tech making significant contributions to diverse fields such as finance, communications, and aerospace. Yet, it’s worth noting that the medical field has also been influenced by tech, even though its impact often receives less recognition in the headlines. news.headline: Teleflex Awarded Peripheral Access Agreement with Premier, Inc.
news.summary: WAYNE, Pa., Dec. 05, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Teleflex Incorporated (NYSE: TFX), a leading global provider of medical technologies, today announced it was awarded the Peripheral Access purchasing agreement with Premier, Inc. Effective December 1st, 2023, the new agreement allows Premier members, at their discretion, to take advantage of special pricing and terms pre-negotiated by Premier for Teleflex’s Peripheral Access products.
